trans-unit.source: Best Practices for Handling State in Azure Resource Manager Templates
trans-unit.target: Best Practices for Handling State in Azure Resource Manager Templates

trans-unit.source: Shows recommended approaches for using complex objects to share state data with Azure Resource Manager templates and linked templates
trans-unit.target: Shows recommended approaches for using complex objects to share state data with Azure Resource Manager templates and linked templates

trans-unit.source: Sharing state in Azure Resource Manager templates
trans-unit.target: Sharing state in Azure Resource Manager templates

trans-unit.source: This topic shows best practices for managing and sharing state within an Azure Resource Manager template and across linked templates.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows best practices for managing and sharing state within an Azure Resource Manager template and across linked templates.

trans-unit.source: The parameters and variables shown in this topic are examples of the type of objects you can define to conveniently organize your deployment requirements.
trans-unit.target: The parameters and variables shown in this topic are examples of the type of objects you can define to conveniently organize your deployment requirements.

trans-unit.source: From these examples, you can implement your own objects with property values that make sense for your environment.
trans-unit.target: From these examples, you can implement your own objects with property values that make sense for your environment.

trans-unit.source: Using complex objects to share state
trans-unit.target: Using complex objects to share state

trans-unit.source: In addition to single-value parameters, you can use complex objects as parameters in an Azure Resource Manager template.
trans-unit.target: In addition to single-value parameters, you can use complex objects as parameters in an Azure Resource Manager template.

trans-unit.source: With complex objects, you can implement and reference collections of data for a specific area
trans-unit.target: With complex objects, you can implement and reference collections of data for a specific area

trans-unit.source: such as t-shirt size (for describing a virtual machine), network settings, operating system (OS) settings, and availability settings.
trans-unit.target: such as t-shirt size (for describing a virtual machine), network settings, operating system (OS) settings, and availability settings.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to define variables that contain complex objects for representing collections of data.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to define variables that contain complex objects for representing collections of data.

trans-unit.source: The collections define values that are used for virtual machine size, network settings,
trans-unit.target: The collections define values that are used for virtual machine size, network settings,

trans-unit.source: operating system settings and availability settings.
trans-unit.target: operating system settings and availability settings.

trans-unit.source: You can then reference these variables later in the template.
trans-unit.target: You can then reference these variables later in the template.

trans-unit.source: The ability to reference named-variables and their properties simplifies the template syntax,
trans-unit.target: The ability to reference named-variables and their properties simplifies the template syntax,

trans-unit.source: and makes it easy to understand context.
trans-unit.target: and makes it easy to understand context.

trans-unit.source: The following example defines a resource to deploy by using the objects shown above to set values.
trans-unit.target: The following example defines a resource to deploy by using the objects shown above to set values.

trans-unit.source: For example, note that the VM size is set by retrieving the value
trans-unit.target: For example, note that the VM size is set by retrieving the value

trans-unit.source: for variables('tshirtSize').vmSize while the value for the disk size is retrieved from variables('tshirtSize').diskSize.
trans-unit.target: for variables('tshirtSize').vmSize while the value for the disk size is retrieved from variables('tshirtSize').diskSize.

trans-unit.source: In addition, the URI for a linked template is set with the
trans-unit.target: In addition, the URI for a linked template is set with the

trans-unit.source: value for variables('tshirtSize').vmTemplate.
trans-unit.target: value for variables('tshirtSize').vmTemplate.

trans-unit.source: Passing state to a template and its linked templates
trans-unit.target: Passing state to a template and its linked templates

trans-unit.source: You can share state information into a template and its linked templates through:
trans-unit.target: You can share state information into a template and its linked templates through:

trans-unit.source: parameters that you provide directly to the main template during deployment
trans-unit.target: parameters that you provide directly to the main template during deployment

trans-unit.source: parameters, static variables, and generated variables that the main template shares with its linked templates
trans-unit.target: parameters, static variables, and generated variables that the main template shares with its linked templates

trans-unit.source: Common parameters provided to the main template
trans-unit.target: Common parameters provided to the main template

trans-unit.source: The following table lists commonly-used parameters in templates.
trans-unit.target: The following table lists commonly-used parameters in templates.

trans-unit.source: Commonly used parameters passed to the main template
trans-unit.target: Commonly used parameters passed to the main template

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: location
trans-unit.target: location

trans-unit.source: String from a constrained list of Azure regions
trans-unit.target: String from a constrained list of Azure regions

trans-unit.source: The location where the resources will be deployed.
trans-unit.target: The location where the resources will be deployed.

trans-unit.source: storageAccountNamePrefix
trans-unit.target: storageAccountNamePrefix

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: Unique DNS name for the Storage Account where the VM's disks will be placed
trans-unit.target: Unique DNS name for the Storage Account where the VM's disks will be placed

trans-unit.source: domainName
trans-unit.target: domainName

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: Domain name of the publicly accessible jumpbox VM in the format: {domainName}.{location}.cloudapp.com For example: mydomainname.westus.cloudapp.azure.com
trans-unit.target: Domain name of the publicly accessible jumpbox VM in the format: {domainName}.{location}.cloudapp.com For example: mydomainname.westus.cloudapp.azure.com

trans-unit.source: adminUsername
trans-unit.target: adminUsername

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: Username for the VMs
trans-unit.target: Username for the VMs

trans-unit.source: adminPassword
trans-unit.target: adminPassword

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: Password for the VMs
trans-unit.target: Password for the VMs

trans-unit.source: tshirtSize
trans-unit.target: tshirtSize

trans-unit.source: String from a constrained list of offered t-shirt sizes
trans-unit.target: String from a constrained list of offered t-shirt sizes

trans-unit.source: The named scale unit size to provision.
trans-unit.target: The named scale unit size to provision.

trans-unit.source: For example, "Small", "Medium", "Large"
trans-unit.target: For example, "Small", "Medium", "Large"

trans-unit.source: virtualNetworkName
trans-unit.target: virtualNetworkName

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: Name of the virtual network that the consumer wants to use.
trans-unit.target: Name of the virtual network that the consumer wants to use.

trans-unit.source: enableJumpbox
trans-unit.target: enableJumpbox

trans-unit.source: String from a constrained list (enabled/disabled)
trans-unit.target: String from a constrained list (enabled/disabled)

trans-unit.source: Parameter that identifies whether to enable a jumpbox for the environment.
trans-unit.target: Parameter that identifies whether to enable a jumpbox for the environment.

trans-unit.source: Values: "enabled", "disabled"
trans-unit.target: Values: "enabled", "disabled"

trans-unit.source: Parameters sent to linked templates
trans-unit.target: Parameters sent to linked templates

trans-unit.source: When connecting to linked templates, you will often use a mix of static and generated variables.
trans-unit.target: When connecting to linked templates, you will often use a mix of static and generated variables.

trans-unit.source: Static variables
trans-unit.target: Static variables

trans-unit.source: Static variables are often used to provide base values, such as URLs, that are used throughout a template or as values that are used to compose values for dynamic variables.
trans-unit.target: Static variables are often used to provide base values, such as URLs, that are used throughout a template or as values that are used to compose values for dynamic variables.

trans-unit.source: In the template excerpt below, templateBaseUrl specifies the root location for the template in GitHub.
trans-unit.target: In the template excerpt below, templateBaseUrl specifies the root location for the template in GitHub.

trans-unit.source: The next line builds a new variable sharedTemplateUrl that concatenates the
trans-unit.target: The next line builds a new variable sharedTemplateUrl that concatenates the

trans-unit.source: value of templateBaseUrl with the known name of the shared resources template.
trans-unit.target: value of templateBaseUrl with the known name of the shared resources template.

trans-unit.source: Below that, a complex object variable is used to store a t-shirt size, where the templateBaseUrl is
trans-unit.target: Below that, a complex object variable is used to store a t-shirt size, where the templateBaseUrl is

trans-unit.source: concatenated to specify the known configuration template location stored in the vmTemplate property.
trans-unit.target: concatenated to specify the known configuration template location stored in the vmTemplate property.

trans-unit.source: The benefit of this approach is you can easily move, fork, or use the template as a base for a new one.
trans-unit.target: The benefit of this approach is you can easily move, fork, or use the template as a base for a new one.

trans-unit.source: If the template location changes, you only need to change the static variable
trans-unit.target: If the template location changes, you only need to change the static variable

trans-unit.source: in the one place — the main template — which passes it throughout the templates.
trans-unit.target: in the one place — the main template — which passes it throughout the templates.

trans-unit.source: Generated variables
trans-unit.target: Generated variables

trans-unit.source: In addition to static variables, a number of variables are generated dynamically.
trans-unit.target: In addition to static variables, a number of variables are generated dynamically.

trans-unit.source: This section identifies some of the common types of generated variables.
trans-unit.target: This section identifies some of the common types of generated variables.

trans-unit.source: tshirtSize
trans-unit.target: tshirtSize

trans-unit.source: When calling the main template, you can select a t-shirt size from a fixed number of options, which typically include values such as Small, Medium, and Large.
trans-unit.target: When calling the main template, you can select a t-shirt size from a fixed number of options, which typically include values such as Small, Medium, and Large.

trans-unit.source: In the main template, this option appears as a parameter such as tshirtSize:
trans-unit.target: In the main template, this option appears as a parameter such as tshirtSize:

trans-unit.source: Within the main template, variables correspond to each of the sizes.
trans-unit.target: Within the main template, variables correspond to each of the sizes.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the available sizes are small, medium, and large, the variables section would include variables
trans-unit.target: For example, if the available sizes are small, medium, and large, the variables section would include variables

trans-unit.source: named tshirtSizeSmall, tshirtSizeMedium, and tshirtSizeLarge.
trans-unit.target: named tshirtSizeSmall, tshirtSizeMedium, and tshirtSizeLarge.

trans-unit.source: As the following example shows, these variables define the properties of a particular t-shirt size.
trans-unit.target: As the following example shows, these variables define the properties of a particular t-shirt size.

trans-unit.source: Each identifies the VM type, disk size, associated scale unit resource template
trans-unit.target: Each identifies the VM type, disk size, associated scale unit resource template

trans-unit.source: to link to, number of instances, storage account details, and jumpbox status.
trans-unit.target: to link to, number of instances, storage account details, and jumpbox status.

trans-unit.source: The storage account name prefix is taken from a parameter supplied by a user, and the linked template is the concatenation of the base URL for the template and the filename of a specific scale unit resource template.
trans-unit.target: The storage account name prefix is taken from a parameter supplied by a user, and the linked template is the concatenation of the base URL for the template and the filename of a specific scale unit resource template.

trans-unit.source: The tshirtSize variable appears further down in the variables section.
trans-unit.target: The tshirtSize variable appears further down in the variables section.

trans-unit.source: The end of the t-shirt size you provided (Small, Medium, Large) is concatenated with the text tshirtSize to retrieve the
trans-unit.target: The end of the t-shirt size you provided (Small, Medium, Large) is concatenated with the text tshirtSize to retrieve the

trans-unit.source: associated complex object variable for that t-shirt size:
trans-unit.target: associated complex object variable for that t-shirt size:

trans-unit.source: This variable is passed to the linked scale unit resource template.
trans-unit.target: This variable is passed to the linked scale unit resource template.

trans-unit.source: networkSettings
trans-unit.target: networkSettings

trans-unit.source: In a capacity, capability, or end-to-end scoped solution template, the linked templates typically create resources that exist on a network.
trans-unit.target: In a capacity, capability, or end-to-end scoped solution template, the linked templates typically create resources that exist on a network.

trans-unit.source: One straightforward approach is to use a complex object to store
trans-unit.target: One straightforward approach is to use a complex object to store

trans-unit.source: network settings and pass them to linked templates.
trans-unit.target: network settings and pass them to linked templates.

trans-unit.source: An example of communicating network settings can be seen below.
trans-unit.target: An example of communicating network settings can be seen below.

trans-unit.source: availabilitySettings
trans-unit.target: availabilitySettings

trans-unit.source: Resources created in linked templates are often placed in an availability set.
trans-unit.target: Resources created in linked templates are often placed in an availability set.

trans-unit.source: In the following example, the availability set name is specified and also the fault domain and update domain count to use.
trans-unit.target: In the following example, the availability set name is specified and also the fault domain and update domain count to use.

trans-unit.source: If you need multiple availability sets (for example, one for master nodes and another for data nodes), you can use a name as a prefix, specify multiple availability sets, or follow the model shown earlier
trans-unit.target: If you need multiple availability sets (for example, one for master nodes and another for data nodes), you can use a name as a prefix, specify multiple availability sets, or follow the model shown earlier

trans-unit.source: for creating a variable for a specific t-shirt size.
trans-unit.target: for creating a variable for a specific t-shirt size.

trans-unit.source: storageSettings
trans-unit.target: storageSettings

trans-unit.source: Storage details are often shared with linked templates.
trans-unit.target: Storage details are often shared with linked templates.

trans-unit.source: In the example below, a storageSettings object provides details about the storage account and container names.
trans-unit.target: In the example below, a storageSettings object provides details about the storage account and container names.

trans-unit.source: osSettings
trans-unit.target: osSettings

trans-unit.source: With linked templates, you may need to pass operating system settings to various nodes types across different known configuration types.
trans-unit.target: With linked templates, you may need to pass operating system settings to various nodes types across different known configuration types.

trans-unit.source: A complex object is an easy way to store and share operating system information and also makes
trans-unit.target: A complex object is an easy way to store and share operating system information and also makes

trans-unit.source: it easier to support multiple operating system choices for deployment.
trans-unit.target: it easier to support multiple operating system choices for deployment.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows an object for osSettings:
trans-unit.target: The following example shows an object for osSettings:

trans-unit.source: machineSettings
trans-unit.target: machineSettings

trans-unit.source: A generated variable, machineSettings is a complex object containing a mix of core variables for creating a new VM: administrator user name and password, a prefix for the VM names, and an operating
trans-unit.target: A generated variable, machineSettings is a complex object containing a mix of core variables for creating a new VM: administrator user name and password, a prefix for the VM names, and an operating

trans-unit.source: system image reference as shown below:
trans-unit.target: system image reference as shown below:

trans-unit.source: Note that osImageReference retrieves the values from the osSettings variable defined in the main template.
trans-unit.target: Note that osImageReference retrieves the values from the osSettings variable defined in the main template.

trans-unit.source: That means you can easily change the operating system for a VM—entirely or based
trans-unit.target: That means you can easily change the operating system for a VM—entirely or based

trans-unit.source: on the preference of a template consumer.
trans-unit.target: on the preference of a template consumer.

trans-unit.source: vmScripts
trans-unit.target: vmScripts

trans-unit.source: The vmScripts object contains details about the scripts to download and execute on a VM instance, including outside and inside references.
trans-unit.target: The vmScripts object contains details about the scripts to download and execute on a VM instance, including outside and inside references.

trans-unit.source: Outside references include the infrastructure.
trans-unit.target: Outside references include the infrastructure.

trans-unit.source: Inside references include the installed software installed and configuration.
trans-unit.target: Inside references include the installed software installed and configuration.

trans-unit.source: You use the scriptsToDownload property to list the scripts to download to the VM.
trans-unit.target: You use the scriptsToDownload property to list the scripts to download to the VM.

trans-unit.source: As the example below shows, this object also contains references to command-line arguments for different types of actions.
trans-unit.target: As the example below shows, this object also contains references to command-line arguments for different types of actions.

trans-unit.source: These actions include executing the default installation for
trans-unit.target: These actions include executing the default installation for

trans-unit.source: each individual node, an installation that runs after all nodes are deployed, and any additional scripts that may be specific to a given template.
trans-unit.target: each individual node, an installation that runs after all nodes are deployed, and any additional scripts that may be specific to a given template.

trans-unit.source: This example is from a template used to deploy MongoDB, which requires an arbiter to deliver high availability.
trans-unit.target: This example is from a template used to deploy MongoDB, which requires an arbiter to deliver high availability.

trans-unit.source: The arbiterNodeInstallCommand has been added to vmScripts to install the arbiter.
trans-unit.target: The arbiterNodeInstallCommand has been added to vmScripts to install the arbiter.

trans-unit.source: The variables section is where you’ll find the variables that define the specific text to execute the script with the proper values.
trans-unit.target: The variables section is where you’ll find the variables that define the specific text to execute the script with the proper values.

trans-unit.source: Returning state from a template
trans-unit.target: Returning state from a template

trans-unit.source: Not only can you pass data into a template, you can also share data back to the calling template.
trans-unit.target: Not only can you pass data into a template, you can also share data back to the calling template.

trans-unit.source: In the outputs section of a linked template, you can provide key/value pairs that can be consumed
trans-unit.target: In the outputs section of a linked template, you can provide key/value pairs that can be consumed

trans-unit.source: by the source template.
trans-unit.target: by the source template.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to pass the private IP address generated in a linked template.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to pass the private IP address generated in a linked template.

trans-unit.target: Within the main template, you can use that data with the following syntax:
